example.description: Slider and Textbox 2 gets its values from Spinner. Textbox 1 gets its value from Spinner caption, which could be set by user using databindings.
example.source:
<a:model id="mdlSpinner1"> <overview page="3" pages="50" /> </a:model> <a:table columns="150" padding="5" model="mdlSpinner1"> <a:spinner id = "sp7" min = "0" max = "50" value = "[@page]" />
<a:slider min = "0" max = "50" mask = "#" height = "8" step = "1" value = "{sp7.value}"> </a:slider>
<a:label model="mdlSpinner1" value="[@page] of [@pages]"></a:label> </a:table>

example.description: Slider updates it's value realtime and not
example.source:
<a:table columns="150, 150" cellheight="19" padding="5"> <a:label>Realtime update</a:label> <a:label>No realtime update</a:label> <a:textbox value="{slider2.value}"></a:textbox> <a:textbox value="{slider2_2.value}"></a:textbox>
<a:slider id = "slider2" min = "0" max = "50" height = "8" realtime = "true"> </a:slider> <a:slider id = "slider2_2" min = "0" max = "50" height = "8" realtime = "false"> </a:slider>
<a:label height="24" /> <a:button onclick="slider2_2.setValue(15)">Set Value to Slider</a:button> </a:table>

example.description: This example shows three sliders which lets the user indicate a value in a form.
example.source:
<a:table columns = "80,150" padding = "8" margin = "20" cellheight = "19"> <a:label>Numerical</a:label> <a:slider height="8" margin="6 0 0 0" min = "0" mask = "#" max = "65" step = "1"> </a:slider>
<a:label>Labels</a:label> <a:slider height="8" margin="6 0 0 0" min = "0" max = "6" step = "1" mask = "No opinion;Terrible;Bad;Acceptable;Decent;Good;Splendid" markers = "true" slide = "snap"> </a:slider>
<a:label>Discreet snapping</a:label> <a:slider height="8" margin="6 0 0 0" width = "500" min = "0" max = "100" step = "10" markers = "true"> </a:slider> </a:table>
